_header: She that I love aldermost and lovest to beguile
_description: Verse on his mistress being ever in his thoughts — one 6-line stanza including an ‘Y and O’ refrain

HunHM503.Transcription:
Sche þat y loue alle þer moost & loþist to be
                    gilesche dwelliþ out in a wildirnes so fer out in a myle& it
                    was bi twix us to but an hundir mylesche myȝt not be out of my
                    rouȝt a pater noster whilewiþ a ny & a no crist y hir
                    biteche& y lay louesik in my bed y bed non oþer leche
HunHM503.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             “A Middle English Love Poem and the ‘O-and-I’ Refrain
                Phrase.” 
             Medium Ævum
         30 (1961): 170-5: 170-5.
